```{r}
library(ggplot2) # Data visualization
library(readr) # CSV file I/O, e.g. the read_csv function
#library(ggalt)
library(ggthemes)

atl<-read.csv("Historical_Tropical_Storm_Tracks.csv")

##Atlantic- put longitude in proper format and plot
attach(atl)
dat<-as.character(atl$LAT)
new<-substr(dat,1,nchar(dat)-1)
lat<-as.numeric(new)
dat<-as.character(atl$LONG)
new<-substr(dat,1,nchar(dat)-1)
long<-as.numeric(new)
long<- -abs(long)
coord<-as.data.frame(long)
coord<-cbind(coord, lat)
out<-subset(coord, long < -100) ##Find the outliers
total<-cbind(atl, coord)
outRM<-total[-c(22985,22986),]  ##Remove the outliers


world <- map_data("world")
world <- world[world$region != "Antarctica",]
gg <- ggplot()
gg <- gg + geom_map(data=world, map=world,
                    aes(x=long, y=lat, map_id=region), color="white", fill="#7f7f7f", size=0.05, alpha=1/4)
gg <- gg + scale_color_tableau()
gg <- gg + theme_map()
gg <- gg + theme(strip.background=element_blank())
gg<-gg+geom_point(data=outRM, aes(long, lat))+ aes(color = "blue", alpha = 0.5)+scale_color_brewer(palette = "PuRd")
gg


##Pacific, the same
pac<-read.csv("Historical_Tropical_Storm_Tracks.csv")

ff <- ggplot()
ff <- ff + geom_map(data=world, map=world,
                    aes(x=long, y=lat, map_id=region), color="white", fill="#7f7f7f", size=0.05, alpha=1/4)
ff <- ff + scale_color_tableau()
ff <- ff + theme_map()
ff <- ff + theme(strip.background=element_blank())

attach(pac)
dat<-as.character(pac$LAT)
new<-substr(dat,1,nchar(dat)-1)
lat<-as.numeric(new)
dat<-as.character(pac$LONG)
new<-substr(dat,1,nchar(dat)-1)
long<-as.numeric(new)
long<- -abs(long)
coord<-as.data.frame(long)
coord<-cbind(coord, lat)
total<-cbind(pac, coord)

ff<-ff+geom_point(data=total, aes(long, lat))+ aes(color = "red", alpha=0.5)+scale_color_brewer(palette = "Blues")+theme(legend.position = "right")
ff
```
